meanings.sent1: She accidentally rumples her dress while sitting down.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful not to rumples the pages of the book.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy loves to rumples the blanket during playtime.
meanings.sent4: Time rumples the smooth surface of the pond, creating ripples.
meanings.sent5: The wind rumples the leaves, creating a soothing rustling sound.

meanings.definition: Wrinkles or creases in fabric or paper
meanings.sent1: The old shirt had many rumples from being folded for too long.
meanings.sent2: She ironed out the rumples in the tablecloth before setting the table.
meanings.sent3: The little girl giggled as she tried to smooth out the rumples in her drawing.
meanings.sent4: The map had so many rumples that it was hard to read the directions.
meanings.sent5: The rumples in the paper gave it a unique texture when painted on.
